learning_outcomes.description: Define the key features of the developmental disorders that are covered;
Discuss the psychological sequelae for the disorders covered;
Discuss and critically analyze different etiological theories of the disorders covered;
Have some familiarity with classification, assessment and treatment of developmental disorders.
Discuss and critically analyze strengths and weaknesses of diagnostic systems.

assessments.task_description:
The tutorial program utilises student worksheets with weekly activities and discussion questions. Before each tutorial, students are required to work through activities (e.g., read case studies, watch videos and/or explore relevant websites) and prepare answers for the discussion questions. There is group discussion in tutorials based on the tutorial material released each week.



Marks are awarded for attempting the worksheets and submitting them to your tutor prior to or near the start of class. There will be 1 mark for each completed worksheet associated with each of the 9 tutorials and they are not graded. The top 8 completed worksheets will make up the mark, such that students who do not submit 1 worksheet can still receive full marks. The mark out of 8 will be converted to a final mark out of 10.



This process builds the necessary skills to complete the Case Study assignment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Please bring a laptop or phone to complete the quizzes in tutorials.

The objective of this piece of assessment is to assess your knowledge and understanding of the lecture content, tutorial and text readings relating to developmental disorders of childhood. You will be given a 12-item multiple choice quiz which will assess your knowledge for the preceding classes. You will have 20 minutes to complete each quiz and you will only be able to take each quiz once.


You will complete the quiz in your tutorial. There are no extensions.


Each multiple choice item will have four options, with only one correct option. You will receive a mark out of 12 for each of the 4 quizzes, for a total of 48 marks. Your mark will then be based on your best 3 quizzes, so you can miss 1 quiz with no penalty. This score will then be converted to a final mark out of 40 for this component.



The four quizzes will be conducted on:

  • Quiz 1 (corresponding to lecture Topic 1 and 2): Week 4 Tutorial


  • Quiz 2 (corresponding lecture Topic 3, 4 and 5): Week 7 Tutorial


  • Quiz 3 (corresponding lecture Topic 6 and 7): Week 9 Tutorial


  • Quiz 4 (corresponding lecture Topic 9 and 10): Week 12 Tutorial
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: This 2000 word report is based on a case study and requires students to identify a disorder or disorders and justify the diagnosis on the basis of knowledge of symptomatology. Students need to be able to describe further assessment information that they would require in the case and also need to be able to explain how this disorder may have developed and how it is currently being maintained. Finally, students will be asked to outline a treatment plan for the case in question. Students will have many opportunities within tutorials to develop the skills and knowledge necessary to complete this assignment.
assessments.submission_guidelines:
submit via Turnitin

NOTE: You will no longer receive an automatic submission receipt from Turnitin confirming your assignment has been received. You should download a copy of the digital receipt from the Assignment Dashboard and keep this as a record.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
